post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}/switchover` path allows you to start switchover for a mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

parameters.name: mountId

201.description: An `AzureInstantRecoverySwitchover` session has been started to initiate a VM switchover. To check the progress, track the mount `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/vmRestore/vSphere` path allows you to perform entire VM restore of a VMware vSphere VM to VMware vSphere. You can restore a VM from the specified restore point to the original location with initial VM settings, or to any location but with different settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

You can restore a VM from the specified restore point to the original location with initial VM settings, or to any location but with different settings.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd` path allows you to get an array of FCD mounts.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount points by mount point state.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd` path allows you to start Instant FCD Recovery from the restore point to the destination cluster.

Specify the destination cluster in the `destinationCluster` parameter of the request body as a model of the VMware vSphere object. For details on how to get the cluster model, see [Get Inventory Objects](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryObjects).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Instant FCD Recovery has been started. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd/{mountId}` path allows you to get information about the mounted vPower NFS datastore, such as restore session ID, mount point state, instant FCD recovery settings and disks that will be recovered.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All FCD Mount Points](Restore#operation/GetAllVmwareFcdInstantRecoveryMountModels) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd/{mountId}/dismount` path allows you to stop publishing the recovered FCDs and remove the disks from the datastore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All FCD Mount Points](Restore#operation/GetAllVmwareFcdInstantRecoveryMountModels) request.

200.description: The disks have been unmounted. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd/{mountId}/migrate` path allows you to start migration of FCDs from the specified mount point.

In the request body specify FCD migration configuration:

  • Disks for migration
  • Target datastore
  • Storage policy that will be applied to the migrated disks
For details on how to get models of the datastore and storage policy, see [Get Inventory Objects](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryObjects).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All FCD Mount Points](Restore#operation/GetAllVmwareFcdInstantRecoveryMountModels) request.

200.description: FCD Migration has been started. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:

parameters.name: orderColumn

parameters.description: If `true`, sorts recovery tokens in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters recovery tokens by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any repository parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

post.description:

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions` path allows you to get an array of all automation sessions performed on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of sessions to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of sessions to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts sessions by one of the session parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts sessions in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any session parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session type.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session state.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session result.

parameters.name: jobIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by job ID.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions/{id}` path allows you to get an automation session that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Automation session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Automation Sessions](Automation#operation/GetAllAutomationSessions) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions/{id}/logs` path allows you to get an array of log records of an automation session that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions/{id}/stop` path allows you to stop an automation session that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Automation session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Automation Sessions](Automation#operation/GetAllAutomationSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/flr` path allows you to start file restore from a backup or replica of a Microsoft Windows or Linux machine. The operation starts a file restore session and mounts the machine file system to a mount point.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: File system has been mounted.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/flr/{sessionId}/unmount` path allows you to unmount the file system from a mount point and stop a file restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: Restore session has been stopped.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/flr/{sessionId}/validateCredentials` path allows you to validate the target machine credentials in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Get User Code for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/deviceCode` path allows you to obtain a user code required to get credentials for delegated restore of Microsoft Entra ID items.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: User and device codes have been received.

post.summary: Get Credentials for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/deviceCode/state` path allows you to get credentials that are required for delegated restore of Microsoft Entra ID items. Before you request the credentials, obtain a user code using the [Get User Code for Microsoft Entra ID Item Restore](Restore#operation/GetEntraIdTenantRestoreDeviceCode) request.

You can use the credentials in the following requests:

  • [Restore Microsoft Entra ID Items](Backup-Browsers#operation/RestoreEntraIdTenantItems)
  • [Restore Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/RestoreEntraIdTenantItemAttributes)

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant` path allows you to mount a Microsoft Entra ID tenant from its backup and start a mount session required for Microsoft Entra ID tenant restore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Tenant has been mounted.

post.summary: Start Microsoft Entra ID Tenant Restore from Copy
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/fromCopy` path allows you to start restore from backup copy for a Microsoft Entra ID tenant.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: A `EntraIdRestoreFromCopy` session has been created to start restore from backup copy for a Microsoft Entra ID tenant. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/{sessionId}/stop` path allows you to unmount a Microsoft Entra ID tenant and stop a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID.

201.description: Mount session has been stopped.

post.summary: Start Microsoft Entra ID Audit Log Restore
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/auditLog` path allows you to start the Entra ID audit log restore from a backup of Microsoft Entra ID audit logs. The operation starts a file restore session and mounts the log files to a mount point.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Log files has been mounted.

post.summary: Unmount Microsoft Entra ID Audit Logs
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/auditLog/{sessionId}/unmount` path allows you to unmount Microsoft Entra ID log files from a mount point and stop a file restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID.

201.description: Restore session has been stopped.

get.summary: Get All Disk Publishing Mount Points
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration` path allows you to get an array of mount points for disk publishing operations.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount points by mount point state.

parameters.name: modeFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount points by mount mode.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration/publish` path allows you to start a disk publishing session.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: A `PublishBackupContentViaMount` session has been started to publish disks. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration/{mountId}` path allows you to get a disk publishing mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration/{mountId}/unpublish` path allows you to stop publishing a mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID.

200.description: A `PublishBackupContentViaMount` session has been started to unpublish disks. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.summary: Get All File Restore Mount Points
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr` path allows you to get an array of all active file restore mount points.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}` path allows you to get a file restore mount point that was created by a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/audit` path allows you to get a aggregated view of items restored during a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/browse` path allows you to browse file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can use this request in the following cases:

  • To browse the file system before you restore an item
  • To check the item state (changed, not changed, and so on) after you have compared the item in the backup and on the production machine

    • **Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/compareAttributes` path allows you to compare attributes of file system items (drives, folders, files and links) from a restore session that has the specified `sessionId` with attributes of original items.

NOTE
The operation is allowed for Microsoft Windows machines only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/compareToProduction` path allows you to compare file system items (drives, folders, files and links) on the production machine with the items available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`. After the comparison completes, check the comparison results using the [Browse Files and Folders](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseFlrMount) request.

NOTE
The operation is allowed for Microsoft Windows machines only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/search` path allows you to create a search task to find required file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

To get the search results, use the [Browse Search Results](Backup-Browsers#operation/FlrBrowseSearchResult) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrSearch` task has been created to search for file system items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/search/{taskId}/browse` path allows you to browse search results of a search task that has the specified `taskId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: ID of the search task.

post.summary: Restore Files and Folders to Original Location
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/restore` path allows you to restore file system items (folders, files and links) to the original location.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrRestore` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.summary: Restore Files and Folders to Another Location
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/restoreTo` path allows you to restore file system items (folders, files and links) to another location.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrRestore` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.summary: Prepare Files and Folders for Download
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/prepareDownload` path allows you to prepare files and folders for download and pack them into a ZIP file. In response, a download task is created.

To download the ZIP file, specify the task ID in the [Download Files and Folders](Backup-Browsers#operation/DownloadFlrItem) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrDownload` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/prepareDownload/{taskId}/download` path allows you to download a ZIP archive with files and folders of a download task that has the specified `taskId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Download task ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Tasks](Tasks#operation/GetAllTasks) request.

get.summary: Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData` path allows you to get an array of all active unstructured data mount points.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}` path allows you to get an unstructured data mount point that was created by a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/browse` path allows you to browse file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can use this request in the following cases:

  • To browse the file system before you restore an item
  • To check the item state (changed, not changed, and so on) after you have compared the item in the backup and on the production machine

    • **Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Search for Files and Folders in Unstructured Data Source
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/search` path allows you to create a search task to find required file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

To get the search results, use the [Browse Search Results](Backup-Browsers#operation/FlrBrowseSearchResult) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrSearch` task has been created to search for file system items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/search/{taskId}/browse` path allows you to browse search results of a search task that has the specified `taskId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Search task ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Tasks](Tasks#operation/GetAllTasks) request.

post.summary: Copy Files and Folders to Specific Folder
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/copyTo` path allows you to copy file system items (folders, files and links) to the machine where the Veeam Backup & Replication console is installed or to a network shared folder.

When copying symbolic links, Veeam Backup & Replication copies the content that the links point to.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrRestore` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

get.summary: Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant` path allows you to get an array of all active mount points created for all Microsoft Entra ID tenants.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

get.summary: Get Mount Point of Microsoft Entra ID Tenant
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}` path allows you to get a Microsoft Entra ID tenant mount point created by a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Get Restore Points of Microsoft Entra ID Tenant
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{backupId}/restorePoints` path allows you to get an array of restore points available in a Microsoft Entra ID tenant backup that has the specified `backupId`. This request helps you find the restore point that you want to restore tenant items from.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

get.summary: Get Protection Scope of Microsoft Entra ID Tenant
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{backupId}/protectionScope` path allows you to get the protection scope of a Microsoft Entra ID tenant for a specific backup. The tenant protection scope defines the types of tenant resources that were backed up.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{backupId}/browse` path allows you to browse Microsoft Entra ID items available in a backup that has the specified `backupId`. Use this request to find the items that you want to restore. In the request body, you must specify an item type: user, group, administrative unit, role or application.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{backupId}/browse/{itemId}` path allows you to get a specific Microsoft Entra ID item available in a tenant backup that has the specified `backupId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: Item ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Microsoft Entra ID Items](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseEntraIdTenantBackupRestorePoints) request.

post.summary: Get Restore Points of Microsoft Entra ID Item
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{backupId}/browse/{itemId}/restorePoints` path allows you to get restore points that were created for a Microsoft Entra ID item that has the specified `itemId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: Item ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Microsoft Entra ID Items](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseEntraIdTenantBackupRestorePoints) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/validate` path allows you to validate that Microsoft Entra ID items specified in the request body are available in a specified restore point.

In the response body, you receive an array of items that are missing in the restore point. To browse restore points that are available for each of the missing items, use the [Get Restore Points of Microsoft Entra ID Item](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseEntraIdTenantRestorePoints) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Check Microsoft Entra ID Items in Production
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/checkProductionItems` path allows you to check if specified Entra ID items from a mounted tenant backup are available in production.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Generate Microsoft Entra ID User Passwords
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/passwords/generate` path allows you to generate passwords for Microsoft Entra ID users that you want to restore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/restoreItems` path allows you to restore Microsoft Entra ID items from a mount point with the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: A `RestoreTenant` session has been created to restore tenant items. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.summary: Restore Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/restoreItemAttributes` path allows you to restore Microsoft Entra ID item properties from a mount point with the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: A `RestoreTenant` session has been created to restore item properties. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.summary: Compare Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/compare` path allows you to compare the properties of a Microsoft Entra ID item available in a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can compare item properties either between two restore points or between a restore point and production. To compare the item to production, do not specify `newRestorePointId`.

This request is synchronous, meaning that the client will wait until comparison results are ready. Alternatively, you can use an asynchronous request that returns a comparison session immediately so the client can continue execution, and you can process the comparison results later when the session changes its state to `Success`. For details on the asynchronous request, see [Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/StartCompareEntraIdTenantItem).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/startCompare` path allows you to start comparing the properties of a Microsoft Entra ID item available in a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can compare item properties either between two restore points or between a restore point and production. To compare the item to production, do not specify `newRestorePointId`.

This request is asynchronous, meaning that the request returns a comparison session immediately so the client can continue execution, and you can process the comparison results later when the session changes its state to `Success`. To get the comparison results, send the [Get Comparison Results for Microsoft Entra ID Items](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetCompareEntraIdTenantItemResult) request. For details on synchronous request, see [Compare Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/CompareEntraIdTenantItem).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

get.summary: Get Comparison Results for Microsoft Entra ID Items
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/compare/{compareSessionId}/result` path allows you to get comparison results for Microsoft Entra ID items, initiated by a comparison session with the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: compareSessionId
parameters.description: Comparison session ID. To get the ID, run the [Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/StartCompareEntraIdTenantItem) request.

post.summary: Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access Policy
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/startRecursiveCompare` path allows you to start a recursive comparison of the properties of a Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access policy available in a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can compare item properties either between two restore points or between a restore point and production. To compare the item to production, do not specify `newRestorePointId`.

This request is asynchronous, meaning that the request returns a comparison session immediately so the client can continue execution, and you can process the comparison results later when the session changes its state to `Success`. To get the comparison results, send the [Get Comparison Results for Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access Policy](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetRecursiveComparisonEntraIdTenantItemResult) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

"

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

get.summary: Get Comparison Results for Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access Policy
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/recursiveCompare/{compareSessionId}/result` path allows you to get comparison results for a Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access policy, initiated by a comparison session with the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: compareSessionId
parameters.description: Comparison session ID. To get the ID, run the [Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access Policy](Backup-Browsers#operation/StartRecursiveComparisonEntraIdTenantItem) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{backupId}/export` path allows you to export Microsoft Entra ID items from backup that has the specified `backupId` to an XML or CSV file. The exported file contains all item properties that are available in the backup.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: toXml
parameters.description: If `true`, the format of the output file is XML, otherwise — CSV.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{backupId}/uploadUser` path allows you to upload a CSV file and get an array of users, which is ready to be specified in the body of the restore request. The CSV file must contain a list of IDs or user principal names of Microsoft Entra ID users.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

The CSV file must contain a list of IDs of Microsoft Entra ID administrative units.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

The CSV file must contain a list of IDs of Microsoft Entra ID applications.

get.summary: Get All Restore Sessions of Microsoft Entra ID Tenant

parameters.name: restoreSessionId

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: restoreSessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Restore Sessions of Microsoft Entra ID Tenant](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseEntraIDTenantRestoreSessions) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/tasks` path allows you to get an array of restore tasks performed on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of tasks to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tasks to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts tasks by one of the session parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts tasks in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters tasks by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any task parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns tasks that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns tasks that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns tasks that are finished after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns tasks that are finished before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters tasks by task type.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters tasks by task state.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: Filters tasks by task result.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/tasks/{id}` path allows you to get a restore task that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Task ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Tasks](Tasks#operation/GetAllTasks) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/tasks/{id}/stop` path allows you to stop a restore task that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Task ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Tasks](Tasks#operation/GetAllTasks) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/kmsServers` path allows you to get an array of all KMS servers that are added to the backup infrastructure.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of KMS servers to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of KMS servers to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts KMS servers by one of the KMS server parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts KMS servers in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters KMS servers by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any KMS server parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters KMS servers by KMS server type.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/kmsServers` path allows you to add a KMS server to the backup infrastructure.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

201.description: KMS server has been added.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/kmsServers/{id}` path allows you to get a KMS server that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: KMS server ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All KMS Servers](Encryption#operation/GetAllKMSServers) request.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/kmsServers/{id}` path allows you to edit a KMS server that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: KMS server ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All KMS Servers](Encryption#operation/GetAllKMSServers) request.

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/kmsServers/{id}` path allows you to remove a KMS server that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: KMS server ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All KMS Servers](Encryption#operation/GetAllKMSServers) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/kmsServers/{id}/changeCertificate` path allows you to change a certificate of a KMS server that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: KMS server ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All KMS Servers](Encryption#operation/GetAllKMSServers) request.

204.description: KMS server certificate has been changed.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/events` path allows you to get an array of all malware events created on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Incident API Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of events to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts events by one of the event parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts events in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by event type.

parameters.name: detectedAfterTimeUtcFilter
parameters.description: Returns events created after the specified time, in UTC.

parameters.name: detectedBeforeTimeUtcFilter
parameters.description: Returns events created before the specified time, in UTC.

parameters.name: backupObjectIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by backup object ID.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by state.

parameters.name: sourceFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by source type.

parameters.name: severityFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by severity.

parameters.name: createdByFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by the `createdBy` pattern. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: engineFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by the `engine` pattern. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: machineNameFilter
parameters.description: Filters events by the `machine.displayName` pattern. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/events` path allows you to create a new malware event.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Incident API Operator.

201.description: Malware event has been created.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/events/{id}` path allows you to get a malware event that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Incident API Operator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Event ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Malware Events](Malware-Detection#operation/ViewSuspiciousActivityEvents) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/backupObjects/markAsClean` path allows you to mark infected objects as clean.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Incident API Operator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/yaraRules` path allows you to get YARA rules located in the Veeam Backup & Replication installation folder. The default path is %ProgramFiles%\Veeam\Backup and Replication\Backup\YaraRules.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator, Incident API Operator.

post.summary: Scan Backups with Antivirus or YARA Rules
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/scanBackup` allows you to scan backups with antivirus or YARA rules.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Incident API Operator.

201.description: A `SureBackup` session has been created to scan the backup. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/authorization/events` path allows you to get an array of security-related events. These events cover the following operation types:
  • Approved and rejected requests
  • Updated four-eyes authorization settings
  • Updated settings for users and user groups
  • Assigned roles
  • Added or deleted users and user groups

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of authorization events to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of authorization events to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts authorization events by one of the authorization events parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts authorization events in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any authorization event parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: processedAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are processed after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: processedBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are processed before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events by state.

parameters.name: createdByFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events created by the specified user.

parameters.name: processedByFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events processed by the specified user.

parameters.name: expireBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that expire before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: expireAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that expire after the specified date and time.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/authorization/events/{id}` path allows you to get an authorization event that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Authorization event ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Authorization Events](Security#operation/GetAllAuthorizationEvents) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/exportlogs` path allows you to start an export session for Veeam Backup & Replication logs. You can export all logs or the logs generated within a particular time range. To download the logs, use the [Download Logs](Log-export#operation/DownloadSupportLogBundle) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: OK

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/exportlogs/{sessionId}/download` path allows you to download the logs generated by the specified export session as a ZIP file.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: ID of the log export session. To get the ID, run the [Get All Sessions](Sessions#operation/GetAllSessions) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups` path allows you to get an array of protection groups that are added to the physical infrastructure.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of protection groups to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of protection groups to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts protection groups by one of the protection group parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts protection groups in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters protection groups by the `nameFilter` pattern. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters protection groups by protection group type.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups` path allows you to add a protection group to the physical infrastructure.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to add the protection group. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}` path allows you to get a protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}` path allows you to edit the settings of a protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to edit the repository. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}` path allows you to remove a protection group that has the specified `id` from the physical infrastructure.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: uninstallEverything
parameters.description: If `true`, uninstalls all Veeam components installed on the protected computer.

201.description: An `InfrastructureItemDeletion` session has been created to delete the protection group. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/rescan` path allows you to rescan a protection group.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

201.description: An `AgentDiscovery` session has been created to rescan the protection group. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/enable` path allows you to enable a protection group.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/disable` path allows you to disable a protection group.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/packages` path allows you to download agent installation packages for the protection group. Use this request with protection groups with pre-installed backup agents.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities` path allows you to get a list of discovered entities — a list of individual computers, clusters or Active Directory objects processed in the scope of the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of discovered entities to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of discovered entities to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts discovered entities by one of the discovered entity parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts discovered entities in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any discovered entity parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

parameters.name: ipAddressFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the `ipAddressFilter` pattern.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by their states.

parameters.name: agentStatusFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the installed agent status.

parameters.name: driverStatusFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the installed driver status.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/rescan` path allows you to start rescan jobs which can install/upgrade agents on a subset of discovered entities in the protection group specified by `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/installAgent` path allows you to install agent on discovered entities in the protection group specified by `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/uninstallAgent` path allows you to uninstall agent from discovered entities in the protection group specified by `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.summary: Uninstall All Components from Discovered Entities
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/uninstallAllComponents` path allows you to uninstall all components from discovered entities in the protection group with the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/{entityId}` path allows you to get a discovered entity that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: Discovered entity ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Discovered Entities](Agents#operation/GetDiscoveredEntities) request.

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/{entityId}` path allows you to remove a discovered entity that has the specified `id` from the configuration.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Protection Groups](Protection-Groups#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: Discovered entity ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Discovered Entities](Agents#operation/GetDiscoveredEntities) request.

get.description:

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: orderColumn

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts Active Directory domains in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters Active Directory domains by the `nameFilter` pattern. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Active Directory domain. To get the ID, run the [Get Active Directory Domains](Active-Directory-Domains#operation/GetAllADDomains) request.

get.summary: Get Active Directory Objects from Domain
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/inventory/activeDirectory/domains/{id}` path allows you to get an array of objects from the Active Directory domain that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of Active Directory domain. To get the ID, run the [Get Active Directory Domains](Active-Directory-Domains#operation/GetAllADDomains) request.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of Active Directory objects to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Active Directory objects to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts Active Directory objects by one of the parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts Active Directory objects in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.description: Filters Active Directory objects by the `fullNameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any Active Directory domain parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

parameters.name: typeFilter

get.description:

ELoginGrantType.description:
Authorization grant type.

Available values:

  • `password` — used to obtain an access token by providing a user name and password.
  • `refresh_token` — used to refresh an expired or lost access token by providing a refresh token.
  • `authorization_code` — used to obtain an access token by providing an authorization code.
  • `vbr_token` — used to obtain an access token by providing a Veeam Backup & Replication token. This grant type is only used in a restricted mode for integration with Veeam Backup & Replication.

access_token.description: String that represents authorization issued to the client. It must be specified in all requests. An access token can be used multiple times, but its lifetime is 15 minutes.

refresh_token.description: String that is used to obtain a new access token if the current access token expires or becomes lost. A refresh token can be used only once, and its default lifetime is 14 days.

expires_in.description: Lifetime of the access token in seconds.

.issued.description: Date and time when the access token is issued.

.expires.description: Date and time when the access token expires.

RepositoryAdvancedSettingsModel.description: Advanced settings for the backup repository.

alignDataBlocks.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication aligns VM data saved to a backup file at a 4 KB block boundary.

decompressBeforeStoring.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication decompresses backup data blocks before storing to improve deduplication ratios.

rotatedDrives.description: If `true`, the repository drive is rotated.

perVmBackup.description:
If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication creates a separate backup file for every VM in the job.

Consider the following:

  • For repositories created after Veeam Backup & Replication 13, the value is always set to `true`.
  • For repositories created before Veeam Backup & Replication 13, the behavior depends on the value that is already selected.
    • If `perVMBackup` is set to `true`, you cannot set it to `false`.
    • If `perVMBackup` is set to `false`, you can set it to `true`, but you cannot set it back to `false`.

ERotatedDriveCleanupMode.description:
Cleanup mode:
  • `Disabled` — continue the backup chain on an inserted drive.
  • `ClearBackupFolder` — delete existing backups belonging to the job.
  • `ClearRepositoryFolder` — delete all existing backups from repository.

subject.description:
Notification subject. Use the following variables in the subject:
  • *%Time%* — completion time
  • *%JobName%* — job name
  • *%JobResult%* — job result
  • *%ObjectCount%* — number of VMs in the job
  • *%Issues%* — number of VMs in the job that have finished with the Warning or Failed status

  • [For Oracle VMs] Oracle archived log settings

hierarchyType.description:
Hierarchy type. The possible values you can specify depend on the used request.

  • For the [Get All Servers](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetAllInventoryHosts) and [Get Inventory Objects](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryObjects) requests, specify values depending on the virtualization platform:
    • For VMware vSphere: *HostsAndClusters*, *DatastoresAndVms*, *HostsAndDatastores*, *VmsAndTemplates*, *VmsAndTags*, *Network*
    • For VMware Cloud Director: *VAppsAndVms*, *Network*, *StoragePolicies*, *Datastores*
    • For Microsoft Hyper-V: *HostsAndVMs*, *Hosts*, *HostsAndVolumes*, *VMGroups*, *Tags*, *Network*
  • For the [Get All Protection Groups](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetAllInventoryPGs) and [Get Inventory Objects for Specific Protection Group](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryForPG) requests, use the following values: *Computers*, *Clusters*

Possible values: *platform*, *size*, *hostName*, *name*, *type*, *objectId*, *urn*. Names of `AgentObjectModel` properties are supported in the [Get All Protection Groups](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetAllInventoryPGs) request.

PerformanceTierAdvancedSettingsModel.description: Advanced settings of the performance tier.

perVmBackup.description:
If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication creates a separate backup file for every VM in the job.

Consider the following:

  • For repositories created after Veeam Backup & Replication 13, the value is always set to `true`.
  • For repositories created before Veeam Backup & Replication 13, the behavior depends on the value that is already selected.
    • If `perVMBackup` is set to `true`, you cannot set it to `false`.
    • If `perVMBackup` is set to `false`, you can set it to `true`, but you cannot set it back to `false`.

fullWhenExtentOffline.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication creates a full backup file instead of an incremental backup file in case the required extent is offline.

enforceStrictPlacementPolicy.description: If `true`, the backup job fails in case the placement policy cannot be met.

x-enumDescriptions.DataLocality: Veeam Backup & Replication stores full and incremental backup files to the same performance extent of the scale-out backup repository.
x-enumDescriptions.Performance: Veeam Backup & Replication stores full and incremental backup files to different performance extents of the scale-out backup repository.

EAllowedBackupsType.description: Type of backup files that can be stored on the extent.

isEnabled.description: If `true`, the capacity tier is enabled.

copyPolicyEnabled.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication copies backups from the performance extents to the capacity extent as soon as the backups are created.

movePolicyEnabled.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication moves backup files that belong to inactive backup chains from the performance extents to the capacity extent.

operationalRestorePeriodDays.description: Number of days after which inactive backup chains on the performance extents are moved to the capacity extent. Specify *0* to offload inactive backup chains on the same day they are created.

id.description: ID of an object storage repository added as a capacity extent.

CapacityTierOverridePolicyModel.description: Policy that overrides the move policy if the scale-out backup repository is reaching its capacity.

isEnabled.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication moves oldest backup files sooner if the scale-out backup repository is reaching the threshold.

overrideSpaceThresholdPercents.description: Space threshold of the scale-out backup repository, in percent.

isEnabled.description: If `true`, the archive tier is enabled.

extentId.description: ID of an object storage repository added as an archive extent.

archivePeriodDays.description: Number of days after which backup chains on the capacity extent are moved to the archive extent. Specify *0* to offload inactive backup chains on the same day they are created.

ArchiveTierAdvancedSettingsModel.description: Advanced settings of the archive tier.

costOptimizedArchiveEnabled.description: If `true`, backups are archived as soon as the remaining retention time is above minimum storage period for the repository.

archiveDeduplicationEnabled.description: If `true`, each backup is stored as a delta to the previous one.

EEntireVMRestoreModeType.description:
Entire VM restore mode. | Enum Value | Description | |--------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | OriginalLocation | Veeam Backup & Replication will restore the entire VM to the original location. | | Customized | Veeam Backup & Replication will restore the entire VM to a new location or to the original location with new settings.

Note: If you do not specify an optional property that defines target settings (such as VM name, destination host, resource pool, datastore, folder or network), Veeam Backup & Replication will try to use the source settings for that property. |

powerUp.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication powers on the restored VM on the target host.

EntireViVMOriginalLocationRestoreSpec.description: Restore to the original location with initial settings.

quickRollback.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication performs incremental restore.

EntireViVMCustomizedRestoreSpec.description: Restore to a new location or with different settings. To get the inventory objects, use the [Get All Servers](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetAllInventoryHosts) and [Get Inventory Objects](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryObjects) requests.

autoSelectEnabled.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication detects backup proxies that are connected to the source datastore and automatically assigns optimal proxy resources for processing VM data.

entireVolumeScanEnabled.description: If `true`, the antivirus continues machine scan after the first malware is found.

disconnected.description: If `true`, the restored VMs is not connected to any virtual network.

EPublishBackupContentModeType.description:
Disk publishing mount mode.
  • ISCSITarget — Automatic iSCSI mode. Use this mode if you want Veeam Backup & Replication to automatically configure the iSCSI initiator, start an iSCSI session and allow the specified target Microsoft Windows server to access disk content.
  • ISCSIWindowsMount — Manual iSCSI mode. Use this mode if you want to manually start an iSCSI session from any Microsoft Windows server that has access to the iSCSI target server (mount server).
  • FUSELinuxMount — FUSE mode. Use this mode to allow the specified target Linux or Unix server to access disk content.

reloadCache.description:
This property is only used when comparing the item to production (`newRestorePointId` must not be specified).
  • If `true`, the mount session cache will be reset for this request and new data will be obtained from Microsoft Entra ID.
  • If `false`, the data will be obtained from the cache.
Resetting the cache slows down request processing but allows you to get up-to-date data. To check the time when the cache was last updated, use the `cacheTimestamp` property in the response body.

SuspiciousActivityMachineSpec.description:
Machine that you want to mark with the malware event. Specify at least 2 parameters.

Note that Veeam Backup & Replication can identify a machine by its FQDN, IPv4 address and IPv6 address only if the machine has been powered on during the backup. If you back up a powered-off machine, Veeam Backup & Replication will not get the machine IP addresses and domain name and will not be able to identify the machine.

x-enumDescriptions.MostRecent: Use this mode if you think a cyber-attack started recently. Restore points will be scanned sequentially, starting from the most resent restore point, until a malware-free restore point is found.
x-enumDescriptions.AllInInterval: Use this mode to scan backup content with necessary YARA rules. Restore points will be scanned sequentially and a malware event will be initiated.
x-enumDescriptions.FirstInInterval: Use this mode if you are not sure when the attack started. Restore points will be scanned in optimal order until a malware-free restore point is found.

useAntivirusEngine.description: If `true`, the selected backup is scanned with antivirus software.

useYaraRule.description: If `true`, the selected backup is scanned with the specified YARA rule.
